intro: Lagenaria hispida, commonly known as the bottle gourd, is a flowering plant in the Cucurbitaceae family. It is characterized by its thick, ridged, bottle-shaped fruit that can grow up to several feet in length. The plant is native to Africa and has been cultivated for thousands of years for its edible fruit. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered with fine hairs, while the stems are cylindrical and often hairy. The flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant.
